required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of White Potatoes on Glycemic Response and Satiety in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of White Potatoes on Glycemic Response and Satiety in Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the present study is to explore the influence of cooking methods on post-prandial glycaemia and its impact on satiety in children.

detailed_description.textblock: Five treatments of (a) baked (with skin), (b) mashed (served hot and re-heated), (c) fried French fries, or (d) white bread prepared on the day of testing will be served to children (9-14 years). Participants will consume the equivalent to 1.5 medium sized potatoes (~250 kcal) or white bread that will provide 50 g of available carbohydrates (defined as total carbohydrate minus dietary fiber). Glycemic response, insulin, incretin hormones glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1), glucose-dependent insulinotropic peptide (GIP)), dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), and cholecystokinin (CCK) will be measured for 2 h (0, 30, 60, 90 and 120 min) following meal consumption, as well as mood and subjective appetite. An ad libitum test meal will be provided at 120 min to assess food intake suppression.

primary_outcome.measure: Ad libitum food intake (lunch, at 120 minutes)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at 120 minutes post morning meal consumption
primary_outcome.description: Food intake will be determined by weighing the meal before and after serving. The net weight of the test meal will be converted to calories
Blood glucose (mmol/L). Blood glucose will be measured in whole blood using YSI 2300 STAT PLUS (YSI Incorporated, Yellow Springs, OH)
Blood insulin (pmol/L). Insulin concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts).

secondary_outcome.description: Measured using visual analogue scale (mm). Each VAS is a 100 mm line where they will place a pencil mark to describe their feelings.
Measured using visual analogue scale (mm). Each VAS is a 100 mm line where they will place a pencil mark to describe their feelings.
Blood CCK (pmol/L). CCK concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts).
Blood DPP4 (ng/mL). DPP4 concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline glucose-dependent insulinotropic peptide (GIP)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood GIP (pmol/L). GIP concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts).
Blood GLP-1 (pmol/L). GLP-1 concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts).

arm_group.description: Test Meal (50 g of available carbohydrates)
Test Meal (50 g of available carbohydrates)

Test Meal (50 g of available carbohydrates)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- be between 9 and 14 years of age
- be healthy, and have been born at term
- be a native English speaker
- not be taking any medications
- not have allergies to potatoes, rice, or beans.
- normal body weight (between the 5th and 85th BMI percentile for age and gender)
Exclusion Criteria:
- anyone with food sensitivities or allergies to potatoes or potato-products,
- smokers
- diabetic or overweight/obese individuals.
